message.body: Hey. I just emailed you the video we're demoing tonight.
It does have music
And its a more interesting equation
Haha. The music is nice.
Yeah I like it
I know the video showed everything but it seemed so quick. But I suppose that's what you're going for.
The audience votes. If the other groups have a lot of friends and family there we don't stand a chance though
What? That's not fair.
Yeah
And we only have 3minutes for the PowerPoint, the video and talking
My God. Then what are you doing the whole time if all the apps will be presented within 15 minutes?

The evening will start with a casual happy hour in the City Council Caucus Room at City Hall, where finalists can set up a "science fair" type presentation. Attendees will walk around the room, and they can stop and chat with you. You can have materials, handouts, photos, etc. to give to/show the attendees. This is a laid back, informal opportunity to talk about your idea/venture.Around 7:15pm, everyone will move into the Council Chambers, and the pitches will begin. Each finalist (we expect there to be five in total) will have 3 minutes maximum to pitch their idea. Powerpoints are allowed, but not mandatory. If you are using a Powerpoint, you must send it to Rachel no later than 10pm on Tuesday, January 27th.After each pitch, an esteemed panelist of judges - Ryan Stewart, Executive Director of the Office of School Improvement and Innovation at the School District; Bill Green, Chair of the School Reform Commission; Stacy Holland, Executive Director of the Lenfest Foundation; and Chris Angelini, High School English Teacher - will ask you questions/offer critiques for about 5 minutesAfter all five pitches/Q&A with judges, the audience will then vote for a winner, and the winner will get $5,000
Ah. That sounds a little scary. Do you have pamphlets and stuff?
I know.
I'm not sure.
I made my coffee. Thank you.
And I like your note
:) Enjoy!
I might make a cup myself. I still feel so run down. But coffee makes me feel unhealthy. Is it bad for you? Or how I make it it's bad for you.
Yeah how we make it
Though it's probably not really bad
I think I'll go eat an apple instead.
We should aim for one teaspoon of sugar
Okay that's definitely better
Oh no.
We should first try the sugar substitutes that my mom uses.
Haha I don't know. They're bad in their own ways
I know. But hey. I only drink like 6 ounces right? Haha. Ooh well.
Yeah but the same amount as sugar as me
I know. But it could be worse. I could drink it that sweet but triple the amount.
How's work?
It's alright, right? Haha. I love you! I'm gonna go down and decide what I want.
It's been a long day, and it's gonna get longer...
:( I'm sorry.
Get home quickly tonight so I can make you feel better.
Are you just staying at work a little late then setting out?
And how are you feeling?
I'm a little nervous for you!
I'm on my way now
Well good luck! I hope the presentation goes well. And you'll be fine. Everyone loves you. Just smile, good looking :)
And you are very good looking. I've been thinking about you in those plants all day. Haha. At first I don't think I was a fan of them but you look great in them :)
Haha thanks :)
Wow. That looks so good!
Are those bottles of wine in the background?
Bring me home a pamphlet!
Haha yeah it's happy hour
I will if there are any left
If not they'll print more
Ok. Have fun. See you later. Love you.
Hey baby. How everything went well. I'm trying to stay awake but I'm failing. See you when you get in.
Hey we just finished. We didn't win but it was cool. Tim and Olivia wanted to eat
Man. I thought your silence meant you were still there and might have won. I was getting hopeful! Haha. But ok. See you soon.
No we were competing against people helping the community. We were out of place.
Ugh. Whatevs. You're helping the community of helpless teenagers who struggle with algebra!
Haha
Haha that didn't really fly
Where are you now. I really want to see you.
Sorry. Maybe I misread. Did you finish eating around nine or are you still out? You know me. I'm just worrying.
I caught the bus
Ok
